title: Add German translation
bodyText:
Thanks for your work on this truly amazing file manager 👍 Here is your German translation ;). There were some rather unusual English wordings I stumbled upon like the verbs with the -ing suffix (I'd rather say deleted or deleting file... ) or all your kinds of modes which may be a bit confusing; and sometimes too much Capitalizing for my liking. Also, wouldn't it be easier if arrays.xml contained string references instead of hard-coded strings so one would only need to translate one file?
Maybe I'll correct some of it in another pull request when I find the time. Other than that, keep up the great work!

title: Added Windows style folder union
bodyText:
t/                                 t/                            t/
|-- b                              |-- n                         |-- b
|-- k/                             |-- k/                        |-- n
|   |-- c                          |   |-- c                     |-- k/
|-- j/                             |-- j/                        |   |-- c
|   |-- d           +              |   |-- l           =         |-- j/
                                   |-- h/                        |   |-- d
                                   |   |-- m                     |   |-- l
                                   |   |-- r/                    |-- h/
                                   |   |   |-- z                 |   |-- m
                                                                 |   |-- r/ 
                                                                 |   |   |-- z

Plus a conflict with t/k/c. Also reformatted and renamed a bit the code. If you find error I will try to solve them as soon as possible. Also if you wouldn't like this feature added by default, at least let me add a setting to activate it. Thank you for your patience.

Really liked this project, so I improved some things here and there:

title: Added setting to change shortcuts and disable shortcuts and quick accesses
bodyText:
This allows the user to change the name and path of shortcuts and create new ones. In addition quick accesses and the entire section of quick accesses and shortcuts can be (separately) disabled.
This also makes other changes:

Making DataUtils an object that's created in MainActivity and never cleaned, can revert if this generates problems.
Added TinyDB that let's you save entire Lists and arrays as a single String preference.
Simplified code in Preffrag by moving all OnPreferenceClick calls to a single method.
Added SimpleTextWatcher that implements TextWatcher and lets you override single methods.
Added vector compatibility library to gradle files.

title: Officially fixes crash when deleting last file...
bodyText:
...but I overextended, as I do, so:

Moved all color literals ("#FFFFFFFF") to colors.xml, deleted some deprecated methods and their last uses.
Created Icons.getTypeOfFile() that returns an int (VIDEO, AUDIO, PDF, CODE, TEXT, ARCHIVE, GENERIC, APK, PICTURE or ENCRYPTED) and used the function is switch statements.
Deleted or commented (and added todo to) unnecessary variables in MainFragment.java.
Moved files around, tried to make Utils package less cluttered.
Created ColorUtils.colorizeIcons() that deals with colorization.
Deleted sticky-headers-recyclerview in libs and made it dependency in build.gradle (it also was a module). The new version has improvements and should be updated independently here.

Epilogue: The crash was produced by this line, but solving it produced another crash deep in Views so I updated the lib and didn't deal with it directly (crash -1, me 1).

title: Restructure to typical format
bodyText:
This is a massive PR in terms of file changed, but the changes are very simple:

Moved app code into an app folder, breaking the build.gradle up into the parts relevant to the app and relevant to the overall project
Commit the gradle wrapper so that the project can be built immediately and the gradle version is dictated for the project. This updates the gradle verison to 4.0 which prepares the app properly for the upcoming changes with Android Studio 3.0

title: Allow FTP service to run when wifi AP is enabled
bodyText:
This is an attempt to solve #515 which allow FTP service to run when device is running with the device's wifi AP is enabled.
It also fixes the problem that URL of FTP server will stay the same when the device's connectivity changes, e.g from connected to wifi switched to become a wifi hotspot.

title: Fixed NPE in FTPServerFragment
bodyText:
This time there shouldn't be any conflicts. Many thanks.
ORIGINAL PR MESSAGE:
Here is the better fix for the getFTPAddressString() NPE.
If getFTPAddressString() throws a NPE, a toast will be displayed (with this text: "Error getting local inet address") and the app will return to the previous fragment (mainActivity.onBackPressed();).

title: #691 Enabled refresh for empty folders
bodyText: Empty folders can now be refreshed through swiping down

title: Fix tar archive extraction
bodyText: Extracting tar archives does not work (all extracted files are empty). The headers of all files in the archive are read and when the stream is at EOF, it is attempted to extract them. The solution is to create a new input stream and iterate through all files with getNextTarEntry().

title: Revert "Remove Async inner class from inside method to avoid memory leaks"

Anonimous classes have an implicit reference to 'this' and thus are not static; this makes them especially prone to memory leaks. Both the code before and after have possibility of memory leak.
In my opinion the best solution would be a public AsyncTask or a static inner AsyncTask with a weakreference to context.
This reverts commit 38586bc.

title: SFTP client support
bodyText:
This is in response to #498.
Before going further, some disclaimer:

For the purists: I was born as Java developer with dedication to server-side stuff (my past jobs were mainly work with Spring Framework (up to 3.0 though)), so my programming patterns may not be compatible with Android's, as well as some decisions I made may not be correct or appropriate
I rely heavily on Android's API and Android Studio's feedbacks to tell me I was doing things wrong. I may have missed something I don't know about with Android
My work was started on 3.1.2RC4 codebase, I may not have take advantage of some Java8 features available to Android (e.g. Lambdas which I saw on some code during merge)
For the same reason, as well as I didn't merge with upstream from time to time, I may have missed some API changes on master. I'd say I did my best to make the merge, but I may still missed something
I used the current SMB client's behaviour as reference, may become the cause of some unexpected behaviours in my implementation
Sorry about the number of commits I made - I used small commits to track what did I do with the code, as well as I was working on different machines on implementing it
Both SFTP and SSH are used in code and comments, they mean the same thing

Then, couple of change warnings before this pull request is even opened:

To deal with SSH keys(public/private, client/server sides) properly - SpongyCastle is used instead of Android's stock BouncyCastle (which was already long outdated). Therefore the resulting APK had hit Dalvik's 65k method limit and multidex had been enabled. The last time I build the master the APK was around 57k, so I think it's a matter of time hit the limit anyway
Because of the way I wrote my SSH client implementation to reduce complexity and coupling, I used AppConfig to access UtilsHandler and MainActivity's Context

Now back to the pull request.
As said in #498, my implementation was an integration with sshj which I saw it as simpler and a better alternative than jsch.
The connection setup dialog was basically a rip-off from SmbConnectDialog ;) couldn't find an icon handy, so I used the Tux icon to represent SSH servers.
It supports both password and key authentication. I tested it against my Ubuntu Xenial machines (home desktop and VMs) on Lollipop and Nougat emulators.
Upload, download, mkdir, delete, rename should be working properly.
Now let the cruel code review begin... wish me luck.

title: Fix app crash on enabling FTP service
bodyText:
App crashed when I attempt to start FTP service using current master (120dbc3), either in AP mode or connected to wifi.
Logcat said
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: No direct method <init>(Landroid/content/Context;Ljava/lang/String;)V in class Landroid/app/Notification$Builder; or its super classes (declaration of 'android.app.Notification$Builder' appears in /system/framework/framework.jar)
   at com.amaze.filemanager.ui.notifications.FTPNotification.createNotification(FTPNotification.java:66)
   at com.amaze.filemanager.ui.notifications.FTPNotification.onReceive(FTPNotification.java:30)
   at android.app.ActivityThread.handleReceiver(ActivityThread.java:3056)
   at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap18(ActivityThread.java)
   at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1573)
   at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
   at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:153)
   at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6171)
   at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
   at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:891)
   at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:781)

It turned out that setting Notification channel ID is only available on API >= 26 (Oreo or later), as hinted on this SO question; so I changed the call a little bit, only set the notification channel ID if app is running on Oreo (or later).
Tested with Oneplus One with CandyRom (7.1.2).

title: Android 8 support for launcher shortcuts
bodyText:
This pull request is another option to fix an issue #771. It differs from the previously suggested fix (#818) mainly in two points:

It is implemented using appcompat and avoids explicit implementation of different behavior for different Android API levels;
It uses pinned shortcuts instead of dynamic shortcuts used in #818. Pinned shortcuts are recommended to use instead of those previously created by INSTALL_SHORTCUT broadcast and seem to provide the same user experience. Appcompat flavor of this feature uses the same broadcast to provide this feature on lower Android versions.

There is also a question concerning the state of license headers. It seems that most of files (at least those I worked with) contain a lot of modifications done, at least, in 2017 — 2018, while all the authors in license headers state their copyright only for 2014. As far as I understand, the copyright notice should contain information on all the years when modifications were done. Am I right with it or should I have just put my name in that list of 2014-year authors? For now, I left the license headers unchanged.
Fixes #771.

title: Use statvfs@openssh.com extension to query disk size/available space for SFTP targets
bodyText:
Concern of running commands on the remote server, whether it's command already available on the remote server or injecting scripts, in #924, which is dangerous.
In previous implementation of SFTP support, remote command was used to query disk size and free space on the remote SSH server.
Luckily, there is a statvfs@openssh.com extension available at OpenSSH and Bitvise SSH servers, the two most common SSH server implementations, allowing SFTP clients to query disk space and free space without running arbitary commands.
As suggested here and here. Specification is here, at section 3.4.
This commit implements such support, and yes, it's tested with OpenSSH and Bitvise SSH servers. On SSH server implementations that doesn't support statvfs@openssh.com extension (which would give incorrect replies), HybridFile.getTotal(Context) and HybridFile.getUsableSpace() will return 0 (not tested though).
BigInteger was used in the first implementation, however changed back to Long in align with HybridFile...and actually I don't know if there is any implication on using BigInteger. Based on calculation, the caveat on using Long is app may crash if disk size on the SSH server is above 8191 petabytes (Long.MAX_VALUE). BigInteger on the other hand can support up to 16383 petabytes.

title: Force texteditor scrollview to fill entire viewport to allow EditText to be full screen
bodyText:
This fix is for issue #927. It was marked as "low" but the impact potential is minimal since it's an additive change to a one-use layout.
Adding the attribute "android:fillViewport="true" to the ScrollView in the texteditor lets the scrollview take up the entire viewport of its parent, which lets its child, the EditText, take up the full height of the screen as well.
This allows the user to tap anywhere in the view to interact with the EditText
I tested:

The cursor still specifies where the user can enter
The text is not erroneously modified with newlines when saving (a newline is sometimes added but that is consistent with the behavior before this change)
All select-copy-paste interactions behave as expected
Scroll view still functions as expected (only scrolling when there is "off-screen" content)

Fixes #927.

title: Moved drawer open/close logic to post event
bodyText:
Fixes #692
Another low priority bug fix to get comfortable with the code base a little more.
The close/openDrawer calls in the MainActivity's intialiseView method were being performed before the drawer finished laying out. This meant when closeDrawer got called (exiting a "tablet" layout), openDrawer got called after in the DrawerLayout.onRestoreInstanceState method.
Moving the calls to open/close out to run when the view posts resolved this. The drawer will now always be closed when rotating out of "tablet" orientation.
Also removed redundant conditionals on the if-else. If it's not not null, it's null. If that is somehow wrong here, let me know.
I tested:

Rotating into tablet orientation (on my Pixel 2 XL, landscape is tablet) opens the drawer like before and forces it to stay open
Rotating into non-tablet orientation, closes the drawer
The drawer can still be opened and is usable like before
There is no animation jitter between the view post and the action

title: Prevent the PreferencesActivity from being restarted when irrelevant preferences are changed
bodyText:
I do not believe there is an issue linked to this fix. Let me know how you feel about my handling of this.
Bug fixed: When changing a preference value in FolderPrefs or QuickAccessPrefs, a double back press is required to exit the fragment.

Currently, every time a preference fragment makes a change, it sets the "changed" Boolean in PreferencesActivity. onBackPressed, if this Boolean is true, the activity ends up getting restarted. On restart, it will attempt to open the same fragment again. This behavior is to handle the multiple screens of ColorPref.
While the logic of telling the activity that the fragment changed a preference makes sense, it does not seem to have any reason to care that preference changed, it just wants to know if it needs to restart.

This change refactors the "changed" logic to convert it into "restartActivity" logic. This new concept tells the activity when it needs to restart rather than when a preference changes. In the future, if a single screen needs to handle restarting the activity, this same problem will come up unless onBackPressed is overridden appropriately for the fragment.
I tested:

Closing QuickAccessPref fragment (closes to activity)

Preferences still set appropriately immediately


Closing FolderPref fragment (closes to activity)

Preferences still set appropriately immediately


Closing ColorPref from the first screen (closes to activity)
Closing ColorPref from second screen (closes to first ColorPref screen)

Activity is restarted appropriately with any color changes

title: Added accent colors to available colors
bodyText:
Not related to an existing issue:
Bugfix: After setting color preferences explicitly through settings (notably to "Default), killing the app and attempting to reopen causes the app to crash on startup due to colors set in theme missing from available colors array
I'm not sure how this was missed, so let me know if I am missing something. Each theme contains an "accent color" (R.color.accent*) but that accent color is not present in the ColorPreference.availableColors array. This causes an ArrayOutOfBounds exception to be thrown after the app is killed and get recreated completely, since the initial color setter requires the color to be in that array.
Fix: Added all accent colors to available colors array
I tested:

All color preferences to verify they started appropriately

The color themes are unmodified


A crashing exception is not thrown on start up

title: Used InvertedRadixTree for GRID/LIST layout setting
bodyText:
Used InvertedRadixTree for GRID/LIST layout setting. This means that a folder's layout will be determined by the lowest manually set ascending relative (or list by default).
Example:
/storage/
       |-- a/
       |   |-- a/
       |   |-- b/
       |       |-- c/
       |-- j/


User sets folder /storage/a/ to grid
User sets /storage/a/b/ to list

Now /storage/ is shown as list (default), /storage/a/ is shown as grid,  /storage/a/b/ is shown as list
And /storage/j is shown as list (default), /storage/a/a is shown as grid,  /storage/a/b/c is shown as list

title: Fix remote file list item not responding on tap, and launchSMB in Android 7
bodyText:
It was found that after opening a file through CloudStreamer, file list item will not respond to taps (view action gesture) if it requires using Streamer, and vice versa.
In short, open a file e.g. on a storage cloud (Onedrive, Dropbox, Google Drive, etc) followed by open a file on a SMB server will fail.
Allocating CloudStreamer and Streamer to different ports is a quick fix; in this PR CloudStreamer will close Streamer instance on acquiring the listening port, and vice versa.
Additionally, this PR also fixes MainFragment.launchSMB() which caused app to crash from android.os.NetworkOnMainThreadException in Android 7, when attempt to open a file on a SMB server.
Tested with Oneplus One running Slim7 (7.1.2), Galaxy S2 running SlimLP (5.1.1) and Nougat emulator.

title: Add 7zip Types
bodyText:
Closes #163
Background:
I wanted an open-source File Manager. Found this one, seemed nice.
OH NOES! IT DOES NOT SUPPORT MY FAVOURITE ARCHIVE FORMAT (7z)!
Good thing I know some ʳᵉᵃᶫᶫʸ, ʳᵉᵃᶫᶫʸ ᵇᵃᵈ Java and it's open-source after all!
Implementation:


One added Dependency: XZ for Java. Commons-Compress requires XZ for Java for 7zip (http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-compress/limitations.html)


Add 7z extension to RecyclerAdapter, CompressedHelper and MimeTypes


Implements SevenZipHelperTask, SevenZipExtractor, SevenZipDecompressor


SevenZipHelperTask is pretty much copy-pasted from Gzip and rebranded


SevenZipExtractor is not as good as could be, I admit. It does is job though. One problem: It doesn't buffer, as I couldn't find a way to do it with commons-compress


SevenZipDecompressor is also copy-pasted from Gzip, rebranded


This is probably my first and last meaningful addition here, cuz I really don't know that much about file managers :P
Sorry for it being this bad, just wanted some 7z support.
And lastly, thank you for making this app!
P.S. "7zip types", as 7zip archives can use different compression algorithms

title: Add support for save files to external storage via ACTION_SEND intent

Note: this won't fix sharing some selected text to device via Amaze - can't find the exact issue #, that will be fixed in separate PR once #1201 is merged. However on such intents which has no Uri but data content this PR should prevent Amaze from crashing.
Test case for verification:

Open a web page with images with Firefox/Chrome
Long tap an image
Select Amaze "Save As..."
Amaze FM pops up, FAB menu button shows a download symbol
Select external storage via the drawer or enter path
On devices running Android versions that have SAF enabled, dialog prompting user to select external device's directory will be displayed
Select the external storage device's directory and the file will be saved there

Not easy to write test case, but did tested on Oneplus One running Slim7 (7.1.2), Nougat emulator (Pixel 2 with external SD card), Galaxy S2 running SlimLP (5.1.1) with 64GB micro SD and GPD XD running LegacyROM (4.4.4) with 64GB micro SD.
One thing that concerned me was MainActivityHelper.checkFolder() was called twice, with only the second call would keep the SAF prompt dialog on the screen - so feel free to improve this.

Certainly I'll want to give a bigger refactoring for better user experience, like ask user for overwrite or not, or specify new filename for the saved file; this is just a quick and dirty solution to the problem, and hopefully, safe to be included in release-3.3.0 branch.
Files written to local, OTG and SMB destinations via Amaze "Save as" calling FileUtil.writeUriToStorage() will perform such checking. If the destination folder has the file of the same name, file will not be overwritten but Toast user that file cannot be overwritten.
Additionally cherry-picked 69ca334 from #1209 to make sure the FAB menu button is visible when "Save as" action is triggered when Amaze is running in the background.

title: Fix parsing SSH URLs with special characters included
bodyText:
Fixes #1333 (hopefully) and fixes #1290. At places where Uri.parse() cannot properly split the SSH server URI for authentication credentials, it is done by hand instead.
WritingRobolectric test case was not possible due to #1290, and included since Apache Sshd cannot be run on Android devices (physical/emulator) so Espresso tests aren't possible either. I had to test with the hard way - tTested with Oneplus One running Slim7 (7.1.2) and Galaxy S2 running SlimLP (5.1.1), connecting to OpenSSH server running on Fedora Atomic Host.
Espresso test for UtilsHandler to make sure data saved to database is not truncated is included however.
Note: I suspect SMB implementation would be affected by such problem too, but since nobody is complaining so far, I'm following the rule of "if it ain't broken, don't fix it" - or in separate PR for next milestone.

title: PemToKeyPairTask refactor: popup passphrase dialog at onProgressUpdate instead
bodyText:
Fixes #1354. This prevents PemToKeyPairTask from never getting the decrypted key at postExecute loop.
Because of AsyncTask's nature of doInBackground() is performed only once, inevitably I need to use a while loop to keep the task wait for a correct passphrase (if there is one), hence making the passphrase popup at onProgressUpdate().
So sorry that I couldn't make an Espresso or Robolectric test that is working, either on device or in Android Studio, so please use the following way to verify (if you need to):

Generate a new key in puttygen, with passphrase (don't worry, puttygen works nice with wine too)
Add the key to authroized_keys on SSH server
Copy the key to device
Launch Amaze FM
Setup connection with the key
Passphrase dialog will popup, prompt for passphrase
Try enter incorrect passphrase, dialog will indicate incorrect passphrase and still block the connection setup dialog
Enter the correct passphrase to connect to the SSH server, as well as saving the connection settings
The next time we launch Amaze again, when we tap on the connection saved at 8), dialog will popup prompt for key passphrase. Enter the correct passphrase to connect to the SSH server

title: GenericCopyUtil refactoring for improving I/O performance
bodyText:
Following discussion at #1572 I made an attempt to improve GenericCopyUtil on I/O operations.

Unified all file copy operations to use NIO (under the hood, using delegation)
Consequently, removed CustomReadableByteChannel and increment ServiceWatcherUtil.position directly
Increased stream buffer size of SFTP and SMB to 64KB. This seems to be the better buffer size that increased network I/O copy performance without risk crashing the app.

Espresso and Robolectric tests for the refactoring are available. Sorry for the DummyFileGenerator in src/main, but it's the only way to make the class available to both Espresso and Robolectric tests - it had been guarded against main app code with @VisibleForTesting annotation.
Tested using Oneplus 2 running Slim7 (7.1.2) and Sony Xperia Z1 Compact running CM13 (6.0.1).
Known issue: CopyService was seen not able to stop after copying multiple files, i.e. the notification pull down did not go away after finished copying, on Sony Xperia Z1 Compact running CM13 (6.0.1).

title: FtpService Updates
bodyText:
I've observed Android shutting down the FTP Server on my Samsung S8+ running Android 9 and my Nexus 5x running LineageOS (Android 8.1.0). This service was not started as a foreground service and according to Services overview: "If the service is bound to an activity that has user focus, it's less likely to be killed; if the service is declared to run in the foreground, it's rarely killed."
The master branch code on both of my devices could not transfer large files via FTP because the version of Android on both of these phones killed the Service before the transfer was complete. The FTP Server service now stays running until it is stopped by the user.
This PR improves the FTP Server performance, but it doesn't address Issue #1572.. Even with LineageOS, I could not duplicate the same behavior as Issue #1572. I also tried using a wakelock with the foreground service, but this combination did not help the user who submitted the issue. I think there is something beyond our control with that user's version of LineageOS that is taking over the FTP Service when his phone goes into standby.
Even though I couldn't figure out what is going on with #1572, I believe this is still an improvement that should be included in future releases.
(edited by @TranceLove: please add # for convenient reference to issues/PR)

title: Added code to check if decompressor is null. Throw a toast if it is.
bodyText:
I found that if the file type doesn't match a known compressed file type, the decompressor object returned by static method CompressedHelper.getCompressorInstance() is null.
If decompressor is null, then the changePath() method throws the NPE on decompressor.changePath(). In order to prevent this, I check to make sure that decompressor is not null, and if it is I throw a toast to indicate there is an issue with the file.
Depending on expectations, the UI response may need to be changed.

title: Feature: add .nomedia to directories with checkbox in Properties
bodyText:
Fixes #769, referenced #844.
Steps to reproduce:

Tap the "three dot" button the right of a folder.
Tap "Properties".
A checkbox labeled "Hide from media browsers" should be visible and its state reflecting the existence of the .nomedia file in that directory.
Toggle the checkbox and tap "OK". If the .nomedia file exists, it will be deleted; if the .nomedia file does not exist, it will be created.

Toggling the checkbox will not immediately delete the .nomedia file -- "OK" must be tapped in order to commit the action.

title: Restrict intents sent to control FTP server to Amaze only
bodyText:
Per mail discussion offline it is found that any app may fire an Intent with action com.amaze.filemanager.services.ftpservice.FTPReceiver.ACTION_START_FTPSERVER or com.amaze.filemanager.services.ftpservice.FTPReceiver.ACTION_STOP_FTPSERVER to control Amaze's built-in FTP server without user acknowledgement.
Changes in changeset

add a custom permission com.amaze.filemanager.permission.CONTROL_FTP_SERVER and set it at signature level
FtpService requires com.amaze.filemanager.permission.CONTROL_FTP_SERVER permission
so only Amaze would be able to send intents to start/stop the FTP server

This supercedes #1814 which contained unfinished code that makes the PR difficult to understand. Its work (to work out a way to allow third-party apps to start/stop Amaze's FTP server) will continue on another PR.

title: Fix #1817 Use root-path in provider
bodyText:
Fixes #1817.
Related issues:
https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/36981306
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42516126/fileprovider-illegalargumentexception-failed-to-find-configured-root
Using root-path seems to be the only working (and undocumented) workaround.
Please test this with non-root and external storage (sdcard).
(Edited by @TranceLove: Added tag for auto-closing issue)

title: Replace jcifs with jcifs-ng for SMB2 support
bodyText:
Fixes #1633 (hopefully).

Replaced old jcifs with jcifs-ng from https://github.com/AgNO3/jcifs-ng
Changed SubnetScanner to become an AsyncTask
Moved SubnetScanner's static block for initializing jcifs to static method for one-time only initialization, to workaround Android's restriction of disallowing network-related code in main thread

Tested on Oneplus 2 running Slim7 (7.1.2) and LG Nexus 5x running AOSPExtended (9.0); server side is Linux Mint Tricia running smbd 4.7.6 with tweaks to enable SMBv2 as described here.
Working functions

Connect to SMB server
Browse folder
Copy file/folder
Create file/folder
Delete file/folder
Stream video/audio

Browsing computers/workgroups never worked in my LAN though (even before this changeset). Please help testing.

title: Revert ZipService to depends on java.util.zip instead of zip4j
bodyText:
Fixes regression of corrupted zip files after migrated to zip4j.
Additionally, sends a ACTION_MEDIA_SCANNER_SCAN_FILE intent so the generated zip file is visible when device is accessible as storage device over USB.

title: Fix Robolectric tests failed to run
bodyText:
Added monkey-patched ShadowMultiDex for supporting MultiDex from Android Jetpack
Limit maxSdk to 27 (as of Robolectric 3.8)
Update code to match updated APIs

Some tests are skipped.

MainActivityTest skipped since it does nothing
TextEditorActivityTest restricted to SDK 24-27 due to possibly bug within Robolectric 3.8, causing tests to fail in SDK 21-23
SevenZipHelperTaskTest2 skipped due to bug at 7zip extraction library we forked from commons-compress. 7zip file in question was not extractable in current master anyway...

title: Ignore autogenerated strings.xml
bodyText: strings-iw and strings-in are generated on compilation, so ignoring them in github is a good idea IMO.

title: FileUtils Intent flag related code fixes and cleanups
bodyText:
Fix #1840 (hopefully).

Remove setting Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_HISTORY flag in fileToContentUri()
Add FLAG_ACTIVITY_RETAIN_IN_RECENTS flag if device is >= API 21
Ensure all ACTION_VIEW intents has FLAG_GRANT_READ_URI_PERMISSION flag
Combine the two openfileunknown() methods, leaving the one using DocumentFile only; old one with File will become wrapper
(Easter eggs are for memories...)

Tested on Oneplus 2 running Slim7 (7.1.2), Fairphone 3 running Fairphone OS (9.0), and GPD XD running LegacyROM (4.4.4). Will try on more legacy devices and test cases whenever I have time for any regressions... but please take a look first.

title: Migrate to Room persistence library
bodyText:
Fixes #1651

Enable use of Room 2.2.4
Migrate all database-related code to Room's paradigm
Move database initialization to AppConfig to ensure it's initialized only once

NOTE: Current implementation enables use of query in main threads, which is not recommended (but still works). New issue can be raised for further improvements.
NOTE2: same code crashed when using Room 2.2.3, complaining database being initialized more than once even I put at AppConfig, but it didn't after upgrading to 2.2.4... and tested only on Oneplus 2 running Slim7 (7.1.2) for database version upgrade and saving a SFTP connection. More devices to follow... YMMV.

title: Add all Android versions after M to unmarshalling hack
Renamed variables for search classes to follow standards
Use package name as CONTROL_FTP_SERVER permission & FileProvider prefix
bodyText: Hardcoding CONTROL_FTP_SERVER permission name and FileProvider name prefix prevents release and debug/developer build co-existence. This commit changes them to use app package name as prefix.

title: Shortcut path fix
bodyText:
Fixes #1858.

Null/empty check for shortcut path before insert into sidebar. Should never happen, but for safety
Changed the dialog for create/edit shortcuts to use WarnableTextInputLayout

title: Use getStorageVolumes()
bodyText:
Use getStorageVolumes() instead of environment variables on Android >= N
There are a few advantages:

Better APIs
Nicer names to every volume
USB storage "just works", no need to fiddle with the extra classes and permissions

There are, however, a few disadvantages:

Cannot reliably distinguish SD cards and USB devices: It relies on device name or path containing "USB" to use the USB icon
The StorageVolume.mPath directory is a hidden API and requires reflection to be accessed (Clumsy, but works reliably)

title: Relaxing restrictions on Operations.isFileNameValid()
bodyText:
Fixes #925.
Also added test case for verification.
Additionally,

migrated usage of HybridFile.getName() to use HybridFile.getName(Context) where possible
partial fixes to test cases to make OperationsTest run (compared to the bigger PR #1831)

title: Fix parsing output from mount command to fix mounting system partitions rw
bodyText:
Fixes #1835.
Corrects the parsing of output from mount command when attempt to mount corresponding system partitions read-write.

title: Fix RecyclerPreloadModelProvider crashing while searching #1862
bodyText:
Looks like a problem with RecyclerPreloadModelProvider.
It's difficult to debug since when you use debugger it works like a charm. Maybe kind of a race condition or something. It can be fixed by disabling RecyclerPreloadModuleProvider or with simple if-else clause.
The issue is not only related to the "android" keyword. I was able to reproduce it when there is more than one search result but it's hard to reproduce for me when I used debugger. I tried to synchronize methods but my knowledge is too little to be able to do it.
Idk maybe it is a more elegant way.
Fixes #1837

title: Fix opening searched directory
bodyText:
Looks like somebody make a typo. If we check if it is a directory we should set boolean isDirectory to true.
Fixes #1872

title: Fix FileUtils on file provider name to use package instead
bodyText:
Fixes #1841
Fixes #1882
Fixes #1883
Fixes #1887
Fix the overwritten hard-coded applicationId with getPackageName() in #1860 on the last-minute merge before pushing to master, sorry.

title: Fix API changes after upgrading Google Play Billing library
bodyText:
After passing #1863 almost all builds going into Travis CI had failed, with error messages pointing to usage of Google Play Billing library.
Sorry for overlooking... but patch for updated API usage is here.
Not sure where to start with testing... so @EmmanuelMess @VishalNehra please help testing it out.

title: Migrate to stock Bouncycastle
bodyText:
Fixes #1870.
Per @Neustradamus suggested and rtyley/spongycastle#34 we should deprecate Spongycastle and use Bouncycastle directly without worrying about package name/class loading collisions.
Changes:

Remove stock Bouncycastle provider bundled with Android
Register updated Bouncycastle provider as first crypto provider available
Remove proguard config related to Spongycastle
Update code to obtain crypto provider directly without prefix

Related robolectric tests passed, Espresso tests were passed on Android emulators running 4.4, 6.0, 8.0, Oneplus 2 running AOSPExtended (7.1.2) and Fairphone 3 running LineageOS 16 GSI (9.0). Also tested on Fairphone 3 with production build (proguard enabled) on encrypting/decrypting files and establishing SSH connections.

./gradlew spotlessJavaCheck

Additional Info
Summary on changes:

Upgrade Gradle plugin to 3.6.4, last version to work with SDK 28 while fixing classloading issues when running tests
Upgrade Robolectric to 4.3.1
Test code refactoring as recommended by doc, enable coverage to API 28. Robolectric requires Java 9 to run tests against API 29, it's still disabled until we found an agreed and convenient way to enable it
Little build.gradle cleanup, removed duplicate dependency and moved some library version to variables

Additional Info

Added a single thread ExecutorService to AppConfig, allow code that needs to run in background. It was chosen over existing HandlerThread since ExecutorService provides Future as return value and allow blocking while HandlerThread doesn't
rename SshConnectionPool.expungeAllConnections() to SshConnectionPool.shutdown()
SshConnectionPool uses Bill Pugh singleton pattern (static holder class)
made SSH and SMB HybridFile.isDirectory() run in background thread using Callable

title: Lifting tweaks in CustomSshJConfig to enable advanced crypto features
bodyText:
Previously due to preventing conflict with stock BouncyCastle on Android devices some tweaks were added to CustomSshJConfig. But with full adaptation of BouncyCastle over the stock one it should be safe to remove the tweaks and use stock features as much as possible.
Tested on Fairphone 3 running LineageOS 16.0 (9.0), using ED25519 private key to authenticate against OpenSSH server 8.2p1 on Ubuntu 20.04.

title: Implement support for SMBv1 without server-side IPC signature check
bodyText:
After switching to jcifs-ng, some users reported they cannot access their SMBv1 servers with new versions of Amaze. It is possibly due to jcifs-ng enforces IPC signing check as described in CVE-2016-2115. This PR add support back, but on per-connection basis, i.e. only SMB connections explicitly disabled IPC signing check will be affected.

Add CifsContextFactory to create BaseContext instances for SmbFile, allow adding custom properties
Implement adding jcifs.smb.client.ipcSigningEnforced flag in creating BaseContext, for legacy SMBv1 compatibility
HybridFile centralized SmbFile creation to getSmbFile()
SmbConnectDialog, add checkbox for enable legacy SMBv1 support (= Disable IPC signing check)
Added routines to handle SMB URLs with query string, for propagating the disableIpcSigningCheck flag when manipulating files/folders on SMB server
Removed SMB specific routines in MoveFiles, as they are actually for moving files on the remote

title: Update Android SDK
bodyText:
Fixes #2057. Everybody hate this because of its "privacy-oriented" storage lockdowns, but it needs to happen anyway.
Related : #1700

Update to SDK 30
Enable requestLegacyExternalStorage flag in manifest
Update test libraries
Fixes to AppConfigTest and DbViewerTaskTest for new ShadowLooper behaviour (default=PAUSED) in Robolectric 4.4

I'm marking this 3.5 milestone since now updates on Google Play will require at least SDK 29. When we need to update to 3.5.1 this PR will become necessary.
Update to Robolectric was postponed to separate PR because some tests will need refactoring to adapt to its default behaviour that Looper is always PAUSED.
Very little quick tests done... on Fairphone 3 running LineageOS 16.0 (9.0), Android data directory is still accessible, and copy from SD card to internal storage still works. Will do more tests on wide variety of devices later.
Please also test on Android 10 or 11 devices to see how you'd be affected.

Additional Info

Marked milestone 3.6, but code was based on hotfix/3.5.1 hence the merge target.
This PR sets last modified date of files after they are extracted from RarExtractor.
RAR v5 is not supported - this means RARs created using WinRAR 5.0 or above is not supported. You shall get a toast saying RAR v5 is not supported when you attempt to open it.
Some intelligence added to detect the first part of multipart RAR archive. If you try to open a multipart RAR but not opening the first part, Amaze will still try to open the first one, when the RARs are named with pattern xxx.part?.rar.

That is, for a multipart file.part1.rar, file.part2.rar, file.part3.rar, Amaze will still open file.part1.rar even when user tries to open file.part2.rar or file.part3.rar.
However, this is not a silver bullet - if you have file.part13.rar you may get file.part01.rar which may actually be file.part1.rar which is not expected. I'd put this as a help-needed enhancement for others, especially those regex experts...

 ./gradlew spotlessCheck

Related PR
Related to PR #
Additional Info
Restrict redundant creation of CIFSContext/BaseContext instances, to hopefully fix #2086.
BaseContexts are saved using in a map, similar to SshConnectionPool, using smb://<credentials>@<host><additional parameters as query string> as key, to allow reusing connections if same credentials (and settings) are used on connecting SMB server.

 Done

If yes,

Device: Pixel 3 emulator
OS: Android 10

Build tasks success
Successfully running following tasks on local

 ./gradlew assembledebug
 ./gradlew spotlessCheck

Additional Info
Fixes #2166. Previous call to OpenFileDialogFragment was using wildcard MIME type while caller (FileUtils) could already know the MIME type advance, causing #2166 to occur. Fixed by explicitly specifying the MIME type.
Also made call to OpenFileDialogFragment.openFileOrShow() to separate methods to prevent complaints about code duplication.

title: DocumentFile-based FTP server implementation
bodyText:
Converted FTP service related classes to use Kotlin
Upgraded AndroidX libraries to latest version
Implemented FtpFile* classes backed by DocumentFile

For Android Jellybean, will use legacy java.io.File-based backend, i.e. Apache FtpServer's default
For Android Kitkat, will use DocumentFile backend using file:/// URI prefix
For Android Lollipop, will use DocumentFile backend using file:/// URI prefix; for external storage, will be using DocumentFile backend using content:// URI prefix
For Android Marshmallow onwards, will all be using DocumentFile backend using content:// URI prefix
Correspondingly, folder chooser dialog will also be different.
For Android before Marshmallow, will be using the legacy folder chooser dialog
For Android before Lollipop to Marshmallow, if selected folder is on external SD/attached via OTG, user action will be required to explicitly grant write permission to the folder using DocumentsUI chooser
For Android Marshmallow and onwards, will entirely be using DocumentsUI's folder chooser
This is a trade off before we can adopt SimpleStorage to our codebase.
Still some rough edges here and there, and also missed a proper unit test, hence making this draft for the time being. Pending #2317 and #2304 pass before tests can pass.

title: Fix ExternalSdCardOperation.getDocumentFile()
bodyText:
It was found that the arguments passed to String.split() in splitting given path was incorrectly interpreted, causing some SD card related operations to fail, especially when there is folder prefix(es).
Original code in Java should be calling
https://developer.android.com/reference/java/lang/String#split(java.lang.String)
while it was then calling this instead, when code was transformed into Kotlin, not recognizing the argument as regex but normal string
https://kotlinlang.org/api/latest/jvm/stdlib/kotlin.text/split.html
For example, for a file on the SD card "tmp/DummyFile", it was interpreted as ["tmp/DummyFile"] but not ["tmp", "DummyFile"], i.e. not splitted correctly. After this change paths should be splitted correctly.
I read that the regex in original code should be just splitting with /... so be it. Only a single / would be enough.
Description
Issue tracker
Addresses #2142 (I don't know if it would fix the issue, so just addresses here)
Manual tests


 Done


Device: Fairphone 3


OS: LineageOS 16.0 (9.0)


on copying files to a subfolder on the same external SD card. Before the fix when the paste happens, SAF dialog will popup even when I had already grant SAF permission to Amaze; afterwards the paste operation would fail.
After applying the changeset this problem will disappear.

title: Update Bouncycastle to 1.68, jcifs to 2.1.6
bodyText:
Description
With jcifs release 2.1.6 which uses Bouncycastle 1.68, we can plug the security hole eventually.
jcifs is using the jdk15to18 variant of Bouncycastle which guarantees compatibility, but should not be the case for us since Dalvik should not really care about Java class versions, hence this PR forces jcifs uses the jdk15on variant which Amaze currently uses.
Issue tracker
Fixes #2169

title: Fix split apks broken icon
bodyText:
Description

ApkImageDataFetcher is responsible for fetching apk icons, it does so by calling getPackageManager().getPackageArchiveInfo(), this method will return null when it fails to parse the apk (corrupted apk, split apk...), my solution is to set a placeholder icon for the apk when this method returns null.
the build failed because core-ktx version was set to .+ which will evaluate to 1.7.0-alpha01, this version has a minCompileSdk of 30 but the current compileSdkVersion of Amaze is 29, I fixed it by setting version to the last stable one 1.6.0.
https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/192484318

title: Make SAF-based backend optional in FTP server
bodyText:
As of 3.6.x cycle the DocumentFile-based implementation for FTP server is causing problems to a number of users. This PR adds an option to allow user to fallback to the original java.io.File based filesystem.
If user had been using the DocumentFile-based UI but changed back to java.io.File based filesystem, shared path will be reset to internal storage's root; user will need to change the path on their own.
(It should be possible to help users to migrate the path between the two FTP filesystem implementations however.)
I am making this against 3.6.2, but just take it against 3.7 if you think it's better.
Automatic tests

title: Add support for content:// URI in CompressedExplorerFragment
bodyText:
Description
As a band-it solution to fix #2650.
When a content:// URI is given, it will query the filename via the ContentResolver, then pass the URI's InputStream to a cache file, which shall be deleted on fragment's destruction or process exit.
Will Toast user if given URI cannot be opened.
There is a downside to this approach. As we will be capturing the whole InputStream for the specified URI, it will become a problem if the content URI's file size is very big.
Issue tracker
Fixes #2650
Automatic tests

 Added test cases

Manual tests

 Done

Device: Pixel 2 emulator
OS: Android 11
Test scenario: open a just downloaded file from Chrome or other web browser, which would trigger providing a content:// URI or downloaded file to CompressedExplorerFragment. It should not crash.
Alternately, try open a compressed file for viewing from Amaze itself. It should not crash either.

title: Fix SSH with password authentication

returns SSH path with encrypted password out to Drawer when calling UtilsHandler.getSftpList()

title: Lenient FTP server connectivity check and remove AP enabled check
bodyText:
Description
Fixes #2720, to accommodate Wifi hotspot function changes since Android 11.
Previously, we relied on fixed IP prefix (192.168.43.x) to determine device has AP enabled, if the device is not connected to network. However as of Android 11, AP address prefix is random, such IP prefix check is useless.
This PR changes the way of checking.

First we check for active network with ConnectivityManager. This should cover any connected Wifi/Ethernet connection
if there is no active network, enumerate available NetworkInterface on device with name rndis or wlan. This should cover tethered connection and AP on device
lastly, remove check for AP IP prefix at FtpService.getLocalInetAddress() and AP enable check

Additionally, moved FTP server keystore's password as BuildConfig field.
Issue tracker
Fixes #2720
Manual tests

 Done

Device:

GPD XD running LegacyROM (4.4.4)
Samsung Galaxy S2 running SlimLP (5.1.1)
LG Nexus 5x running AOSPExtended 6.7 (9.0)
Fairphone 3 running LineageOS 16.0 (9.0)
Oneplus 2 running LineageOS 18 (11)

With AP mode enabled or connected, FTP server button is enabled, and is able to display the device's IP address on above Android versions.
There is one glitch though - I suspect this glitch also exist before this PR.

Enable AP, FTP server button is enabled
Start FTP server
Stop FTP server
Disable AP
FTP server button is still enabled

AP status change seems to be not covered by methods known to us currently. May advice if you have any idea.
Build tasks success
Successfully running following tasks on local:

 ./gradlew assembledebug
 ./gradlew spotlessCheck

title: Add support for non-tarball compressed files
bodyText:
Description
Fixes #3067.
This PR adds support for various non-tarball compressed formats, including gzip, bzip, lzma and xz.
Note that these compression format has no way to tell the original file's uncompressed size and modification time without decompressing (as we know of), hence file size will show up as zero in CompressedExplorerFragment, and decompressed file will only use original file's last modification timestamp.
Issue tracker

title: Migrate from libsuperuser to libsu
bodyText:
Description
Fixes #3033.
Original libsuperuser had stopped development since 2019, and even chainfire suggested migration to newer libs like libsu, by topjohnwu the author of Magisk.

Removed MainActivity.shellInteractive - libsu's Shell object is already a Singleton
Removed MainActivity's HandlerThread for su shell - libsu's Shell itself will handle the threading
Removed ability to run callback for Shell commands. libsu's callback feature is truly async, that our current codebase won't handle nicely

Also, added mount-master flag as mentioned by topjohnwu/libsu#75, to fix problems that only few directories are displayed when listing /data/data directory.
This is still a draft - a couple of TODO:

use libsu I/O classes for accessing root files, for TextEditorActivity and DatabaseViewerActivity continue to work

Manual tests

title: Root based filesystem support for FTP server
bodyText:
Description

Root-based file system backend for Apache ftpserver backed by libsu's SuFile
Logic to switch to root based filesystem if user selects the sharing folder is outside storage dirs which doesn't require root
Warns user of using this root based filesystem implementation

Test case for the file system implementation cannot be done due to shadowing SuFile was not possible with unknown reasons.

ls -a on normal UNIXes behaves differently than busybox's ls -a, causing the need of shadowing SuFile
however test cases using SuFile shadow would fail with weird exceptions related to Robolectric's bytecode manipulation

There is one known issue though: when choosing the sharing folder, browsing above storage level directories may not work since they require root access. When using on Oneplus 2 with LineageOS 18, no directories can be seen above storage level.
(May be solved along with #3061?)

Fixes #1409

title: Truncate existing text files when writing.
bodyText:
Otherwise if the edit made the text shorter, the remaining content won't be truncated because ContentResolver.openOutputStream(Uri) defaults to "w" only.
This wasn't a problem until API 29 because previously the platform ParcelFileDescriptor.parseMode() (incorrectly) treated "w" to be the same as "wt" and added MODE_TRUNCATE. However, that has been fixed since API 29, while the default mode for ContentResolver.openOutputStream(Uri) remained "w", which resulted in such a bug.
See also https://stackoverflow.com/q/56902845 .

title: Prevent Google Play release variant to be able to update itself via apk selection
bodyText:
Description
Latest Google Play policy requires apps to block any attempts to update itself, either via online update or even allow user to install update over itself by allowing user to specify the apk to install. This change implements this restriction.
Details here.
Only Google Play release variant is affected; F-Droid variant can still do this.
Thanks to our user for the tipping!
Automatic tests


 Added test cases (Should only run with play release variant builds)

Manual tests


 Done


Device: Pixel 2 emulator


OS: Android 11

title: FTP client support
bodyText:
Description

Refactored SshConnectionPool to more generic NetCopyClientConnectionPool
Change SshClientTemplate to NetCopyClientTemplate
Implement FTP client support. Defaults to passive FTP and implicit SSL for FTPS
Add optional thread safety to NetCopyClientConnectionPool on executing NetCopyClientTemplate, as Apache FTPClient is not thread safe. This shall bring deadlocks when connecting to FTP servers, but let's see...
Migrated GetSshHostFingerprintTask and SshAuthenticationTaskCallable to callable and RxJava, in align with FTP client implementation
Downgrade Apache FTP server to 1.1.1, as problems found with enabling TLS at Amaze FTP server after previous upgrade to 1.1.4

Issue tracker
Fixes #1570
Automatic tests

 Added test cases

Manual tests

 Done

Tested on Pixel 2 emulator running Android 11, against Amaze FTP server running on Oneplus 2 running Lineage OS 18.1 (11).
Build tasks success

title: Implement cache for improved listing performance
bodyText:
Description
Adds a LruCache for local paths, document files, smb / sftp and cloud storages i.e. least recently visited path will be removed.
For local paths, adds to cache only if list size is > 100 files.
For all other open modes cache is added regardless of list size
Lru Cache size is 50 paths for now.
Also builds separate cache for images / videos / music / documents / apks that are accessed from navigation drawer so that we don't spend time loading them again and again.

title: Access Android/data or obb dirs individually as app package
bodyText:
Description
Instead of previously request for accessing the whole Android/data and Android/obb directories, change to ask for access to individual package directory under Android/{data,obb}.
Also changed display of directories under Android/{data,obb} to comparing with installed packages, and display only those matches installed apps.
Create directory or file at Android/data is not allowed with this changeset, with regards to updated access model in newer Androids, for an easy solution.
No upgrade concerns IMO, as granted URI permissions should have nothing to do with this changeset, since it is not using the URI to list directories under Android/data.
Issue tracker
Fixes #3032 (perhaps?)
Automatic tests

 Added test cases (partial, unit test only)

Manual tests

 Done

Devices:

Nexus 5x running LineageOS 18 (Android 10)
Fairphone 3 running LineageOS 19.1 (Android 12 SDK 32)
Pixel 6 emulator running Android 13 SDK33

The following test cases should succeed without problem.

Android/data access


navigate into/out of Android/data should have no problem, without asking for explicit access
should be able to list directories created by installed apps


Directories under Android/data


when accessing directories under Android/data, prompt will popup brings up DocumentsUI with location set at app package directory under Android/data. User can grant permission to access that directory by pressing "Use this folder"
File/Directory CRUD operations including cut/copy and paste should have no problem after granting access
Navigate from directories under Android/data upward, to above Android/data, should succeed without problem
Navigate from directories under Android/data upward, to other directory under Android/data, should succeed without problem


Regression: OTG access


File/Directory CRUD operations when device is plugged with storage device over OTG should continue to work without problem


Regression: Amaze FTP server (built-in)


If using SAF (e.g. using SD card as shared directory) at FTP server, file/directory CRUD operations should continue to work as FTP client interact with Amaze's FTP server

This changeset is targeted at API >= 30, but may also test on older devices for regressions if available.

 ./gradlew spotlessCheck

title: ConnectionInfo improvements
bodyText:
Description
To tackle problems with FTP/FTPS/SSH URLs having complex characters, and over-complicated parsing logic in ConnectionInfo.
URL format is
<scheme>://<base64-encoded username>:<encrypted base64-encoded password>@<host>:<port><path, if specified>
And because of the changes in URL format, there will be incompatibilities with FTP/FTPS/SSH URLs currently stored in database. You will have to create them again...
Changes:

Decouple ConnectionInfo from NetCopyClientConnectionPool to individual class
Use proven regex to parse URI instead of mangling substrings all the time. Uri.parse() is not working for our URLs here, hence had to use yet another ways
Defer decrypting password until authentication callables

Issue tracker
Fixes #1347, fixes #2964, fixes #3636, fixes #3560, fixes #3739
Automatic tests

 Added test cases

Manual tests

 Done

Build tasks success
Successfully running following tasks on local:

 ./gradlew assembledebug
 ./gradlew spotlessCheck

title: Guard against closed cursors feeded into CloudLoaderAsyncTask
bodyText:
Description
It is reported that on Samsung devices running Android 13 and OneUI 5.0 would crash on setting up cloud connections. From #3670 it was seen that Cursor to load keys for cloud connections was unexpectedly closed. Either it is caused by repeated calls to MainActivity.onLoadFinished() with closed cursors, or some unknown async behaviour that feeded CloudLoaderAsyncTask with closed Cursor.
Wild guess, as I wasn't able to reproduce the problem with emulators, so let's see if adding a guard against closed Cursors would work.
Issue tracker
Addresses #3670
Automatic tests

 Added test cases

title: Bugfix/ssh copy fixes 2
bodyText:
Description

Fix broken session caused by unclosed sessions (again)
Use du command at remote to calculate directory size

One known issue though is the current implementation requires rapidly connect and disconnect from the SSH server, as seen in logcat that a lot of calls to attempt fetching SSH private key for authentication. This drastically slows down copying files over SSH, and the implementation itself does not make sense - that it should only disconnect the SFTPClient spawn from SSHClient when finish copying a file, if it cannot survive copying multiple files.
Such fix shall require bigger scale refactoring at CopyService/GenericCopyUtil that it should make up the list of files to copy recursively before starting, instead of walk down the directory tree on demand recursively. Right now it seems to be the only way to make the best of all worlds :(
Depends on #3884 before codebase can compile DONE
Manual tests


 Done


Device: Fairphone 3


OS: LineageOS 20 (13)


Copy folder of files should be working now

title: Fix issue ActivityNotFoundException on Utils#openURL
bodyText:
The previous code had a bug that makes an ActivityNotFoundException when a user tries to open a URL on a system with any browser enabled, which is common on Oculus devices, for instance. This commit uses PackageManager to check if there is any webview enabled. It includes the following changes:

Added PackageManager query to find a match with any enabled webview.
Starts the activity only if there is a match.
Logs a warning when there is no webview.
Displays a Toast message indicating that no browser is available.
Added some translations of the message

This fix resolves the reported bug and improves the overall user experience when opening URLs.

title: Fix broken OTGUtil.getDocumentFile()
bodyText:
Description
Addresses #4038, that under specific root URI the file/folders should be able to be found correctly.
Previously the code is looking for file by splitting parts of a non-decoded URI against a decoded URI root, e.g.
root URI = content://com.android.externalstorage.documents/tree/primary:Android/data/com.poobslag.turbofat/files
looking file path = content://com.android.externalstorage.documents/tree/primary%3AAndroid%2Fdata%2Fcom.poobslag.turbofat/files

which would most likely fail. This PR fixes it by also decoding the path it is looking for.
Issue tracker
Addresses #4038, as there is still yet to find the way to manipulate the URI root - current implementation of Android/data access is by package, which would still work on Android 13.
Manual tests


 Done


Device: Pixel 5 emulator


OS: Android 11


Delete a directory under a certain package in Android/data would work.
